result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brett A James

records.addlTxt: ORDER OF COMMITMENT FOR TREATMENT/CRIMINAL COMPLAINTS/COMPETENCY REPORT ALL EMAILED TO DHS THIS DAY
Competency hearing on January 6, 2023 at 11:00 am.

10:32 AM Defendant Brett A James appeared by video.  Attorney Andrew T Knaak appeared by video for Brett A James.  Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Heard along with 20CT16, 21CM32, 21CM146, 22CM27, 22CM85. Atty Knaak to be assigned to 22CM85.  State asks the court to receive report.  Dr Seifert Lynch called by the State, oath administered. 10:39am Direct by the State. 10:59am Cross by defense. 11:01 Redirect/State. 11:02am. Court has a question for Dr Seifert Lynch. 11:03am Dr Seifert Lynch excused.  No witnesses from either side. Argument from the State. State asks the court to accept the findings that DE is likely to regain competency.  Atty Knaak argument. Argument that DE is not likely to regain competency.  The court relies on competency report, finds that DE has potential to regain competency, will order DE to participate in competency restoration program.  At this time the state will ask the court to dismiss 20CT16, Court will grant the motion.
Competency hearing scheduled for January 6, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Competency hearing on October 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.

9:34 AM Defendant Brett A James appeared by video.  Attorney Andrew T Knaak appeared by video for Brett A James.  Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Heard along with 20CT16, 21CM32, 21CM146, 22CM27, 22CM85.  22CM85-Adj INit app.  Time set for a competency hearing, report on file.  Atty Knaak and DE do not dispute the report. State contests the report, request a hearing when the Dr would be available.  Set for 30 minutes. The State asks that a scheduling conference be set with all parties present so a time convenient for all could be set.  State would like the scheduling conference with counsels set today for JA. Parties will email JA and set up the conference call. Adj 10:08
Competency hearing on September 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Cases heard together 20CT16, 21CM32, 21CM146, 22CM27 and 22CM85.  Other cases set for Competency Hearing.  22CM85 set for INIT.     Attorney Nelson informed the Court she has a conflict with the cases.  Matters rescheduled for 9/6/22 at 10:00 AM.   Adj. 2:46 PM.
Competency hearing on June 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Competency hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Competency hearing on May 31, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
